<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/13/china-reportedly-will-block-tiktok-sale?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
After All That TikTok Drama...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Frodo saying "It's done"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3oKIPf3C7HqqYBVcCk/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Frodo saying " It's done"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3oKIPf3C7HqqYBVcCk/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">ByteDance has finally chosen its suitor to take over TikTok’s U.S. operations. And the rose goes to…</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...cut to commercial break…</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...cut back...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Oracle</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Silicon Valley software giant beat out some of the biggest names in corporate America to land the megapopular video app and its 100 million monthly users in the U.S. But there’s a reason we’re not using the word “sale.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The WSJ says Oracle will be TikTok’s “</span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsoft-drops-out-of-bidding-for-tiktoks-u-s-operations-11600039821?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">trusted tech partner</a></span><span>”—not acquirer. A full sale isn’t expected to be a part of the fine print. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>would take longer than Dominic Thiem’s victory at the U.S. Open. Last month, President Trump ordered ByteDance, the Chinese tech company that owns TikTok, to sell TikTok’s U.S. operations to an American company or else face a ban. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>TikTok is considered a national security threat by the White House so long as it’s owned by ByteDance. The U.S. fears that ByteDance could be compelled to hand over Americans’ personal info to the authoritarian Chinese government.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>TikTok has repeatedly said it wouldn't hand over user data.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The president’s threat to ban TikTok set off a Frodo-style quest among all the companies that could scrounge up enough cash to place a bid. Oracle’s main competitor was Microsoft (with an assist from Walmart), but Microsoft said earlier on Sunday that ByteDance <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/13/tech/microsoft-tiktok-bytedance/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rejected</a> its offer. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s next</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There are still a number of big questions to be answered, including a) if this isn’t a sale...what are the exact terms b) will it satisfy the desires of the U.S. and Chinese governments, and c) what is the fate of TikTok's legendary algorithm at the center of the dispute? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">However the details shake out, it’s clear that the TikTok saga is a <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/tiktok-reaches-deal-oracle-n1238454?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">turning point</a> in U.S.-China relations. For years, China has demanded steep concessions from American firms to operate in the mainland; now the U.S. is returning the favor with its historic intervention in a major Chinese cultural export. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F09%2F13%2Fchina-reportedly-will-block-tiktok-sale" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/13/softbank-reportedly-near-deal-sell-arm-holdings-nvidia?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
SoftBank Lays Down Its Arm
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="SoftBank Group Corp. Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Masayoshi Son speaks during a press conference." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzk0L3NvZnRiYW5rX2NoYWlybWFuX21hc2F0b3MuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tomohiro Ohsumi via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">SoftBank has agreed to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-arm-holdings-m-a-nvidia/nvidia-nears-deal-to-buy-chip-designer-arm-for-more-than-40-billion-sources-say-idUSKBN2630UE?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sell Arm Holdings</a> to Nvidia for $40 billion in a huge chip deal. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These may be some new faces for many readers, so let's meet the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/who-are-nvidia-and-arm-and-why-are-they-talking-about-getting-together-11599938641?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">main characters</a>:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">SoftBank </strong>is a Japanese conglomerate famous for its eccentric leader, Masayoshi Son, and big bets on the tech sector. Some have worked, some have WeWorked. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Nvidia </strong>is a chip powerhouse, having recently overtaken Intel as the most valuable chipmaker in the U.S. Nvidia's claim to fame is its graphics chips for videogames, but the company is building a bigger presence in other markets like data centers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Arm </strong>is a UK-based chip <em>designer</em> that was sold to SoftBank four years ago for $32 billion. It doesn't make chips, but instead works behind-the-scenes creating the blueprints for them. Arm's designs are found in nearly all smartphones.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What this deal means: </strong>a shakeup in the chip industry as Nvidia adds a powerful new dimension to its product lineup. For that same reason, antitrust regulators are expected to take up to 18 months to approve the deal. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/13/opec-turns-60?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
At 60, OPEC's Lost Its Teeth
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Game of Risk, played in oil barrels " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzkyL2dhbWVfb2Zfcmlza19wbGF5ZWRfaW5fb2lsX2JhcnJlbHMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sixty years ago today, Saudi Arabia, Iran, Iraq, Kuwait, and Venezuela <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-oil-opec-insight/once-an-american-foe-now-a-friend-opec-turns-60-idUSKBN26406P?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">founded</a> the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) to coordinate oil policies and counter the influence of British and American producers. But unlike a<span> cast iron skillet, this cartel hasn’t gotten better with age.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on: </strong>Internal disagreements, the U.S.’ rise as a leading exporter, and a renewables boom have weakened OPEC’s sway. Its market share has fallen from 50% in 1973 to 30%, while the U.S.’ has doubled in a decade. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"A functional cartel needs to set tough limits to production and stick to them. OPEC sets easy targets and still often fails to meet them," Brown Prof. Jeff Colgan </span><span><a href="https://www.dw.com/en/opec-saudi-arabia-russia-united-states-peak-oil-covid-19/a-54875289?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told DW News</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2016, Russia and nine other producers joined the OPEC+ alliance to increase leverage against the U.S. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But American influence remains strong. </strong>U.S. sanctions have sidelined Iran and Venezuela, and OPEC’s de facto leader Saudi Arabia has increasingly appeased the Trump administration's demands, including this summer’s historic supply cuts to offset the nosedive in prices from the pandemic.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY WHOOP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

You Want Wellness Tips?

<img alt="WHOOP" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMTQwOC8xNTk4OTA3MzY1LVdIT09QX01vcm5pbmdfQnJld19saWZlc3R5bGVfMTA4MHg1NDBfMS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">

<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, good news. We’re teaming up with <a href="http://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=9_14_a_primarybody" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WHOOP</a> to deliver them straight to your inbox.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Why WHOOP? They let you track activities, sleep, and overall health with their <strong style="color:#000">sleek, no-nonsense wearable that has 24/7 heart rate monitoring and personalized, actionable insights to help you unlock your potential</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So since <a href="http://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=9_14_a_primarybody" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WHOOP</a> helps you know yourself through data, we thought we’d look inward for our first tip.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>TIP #1, Pre-Sleep</em>:<em> </em>Right before bed, turn off the lights, switch to Do Not Disturb, and simply listen to your body for 10 minutes. Think about what you’ve been through that day, and how you can improve for tomorrow.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And then when you wake up, get a full breakdown of your sleep quality with WHOOP, and take note of any disturbances to see where you can improve. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="http://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=9_14_a_primarybody" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Thanks to WHOOP</a>, we can finally add “Fit-fluencer” to our resumé.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="http://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=9_14_a_primarycta" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Learn more today</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUOTES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/13/best-quotes-weekend?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Weekend Soundbites
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Astra rocket launches from Kodiak, Alaska" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzkzL2FzdHJhLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Astra</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">"Rockets are hard"</strong>—Elon Musk tweeting encouragement after a rocket launched by the startup Astra <a href="https://www.space.com/astra-launches-first-orbital-mission.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">failed to reach orbit</a> in Alaska Friday night. Astra, which also shrugged off the launch as "valuable experience," wants to eventually provide cheap, frequent trips for satellites. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">"We have a good chance that we will know if the product works by the end of October"</strong>—Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/healthcare/516194-pfizer-ceo-preparing-for-likelihood-of-vaccine-approval-before-end-of-year?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">discussing</a> his company's potential coronavirus vaccine. Bourla thinks regulators could approve the drug before 2021. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">"The quarantine gave me a chance to think a lot about things, what I want to accomplish, what I want people to remember me by"</strong>—Tennis star Naomi Osaka after winning the U.S. Open. Osaka, the world's highest-paid female athlete, used her platform during the tournament to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-meaningful-summer-of-naomi-osaka-11600002023?mod=hp_featst_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">draw attention</a> to the Black Lives Matter movement. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">"75 per cent are willing to pay for flights to nowhere"</strong>—The Straits Times <a href="https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/transport/sia-eyeing-flights-to-nowhere-to-give-a-lift-to-ailing-business?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">describing</a> Singapore Airlines's plan to launch "no-destination flights" to boost business. The flights would take three hours, cost hundreds of dollars, and not take you anywhere. </p>

Kate Brown blamed the fires on “decades of mismanagement” and climate change. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSOCIAL MEDIA \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/13/china-reportedly-will-block-tiktok-sale?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nAfter All That TikTok Drama...\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Frodo saying \"It's done\"\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=377 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/3oKIPf3C7HqqYBVcCk/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Frodo saying \"It's done\"\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/3oKIPf3C7HqqYBVcCk/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eByteDance has finally chosen its suitor to take over TikTok’s U.S. operations. And the rose goes to…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...cut to commercial break…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...cut back...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOracle\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Silicon Valley software giant beat out some of the biggest names in corporate America to land the megapopular video app and its 100 million monthly users in the U.S. But there’s a reason we’re not using the word “sale.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe WSJ says Oracle will be TikTok’s “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsoft-drops-out-of-bidding-for-tiktoks-u-s-operations-11600039821?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etrusted tech partner\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e”—not acquirer. A full sale isn’t expected to be a part of the fine print. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003ewould take longer than Dominic Thiem’s victory at the U.S. Open. Last month, President Trump ordered ByteDance, the Chinese tech company that owns TikTok, to sell TikTok’s U.S. operations to an American company or else face a ban. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTikTok is considered a national security threat by the White House so long as it’s owned by ByteDance. The U.S. fears that ByteDance could be compelled to hand over Americans’ personal info to the authoritarian Chinese government.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTikTok has repeatedly said it wouldn't hand over user data.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe president’s threat to ban TikTok set off a Frodo-style quest among all the companies that could scrounge up enough cash to place a bid. Oracle’s main competitor was Microsoft (with an assist from Walmart), but Microsoft said earlier on Sunday that ByteDance \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/13/tech/microsoft-tiktok-bytedance/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erejected\u003c/a\u003e its offer. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s next\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere are still a number of big questions to be answered, including a) if this isn’t a sale...what are the exact terms b) will it satisfy the desires of the U.S. and Chinese governments, and c) what is the fate of TikTok's legendary algorithm at the center of the dispute? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHowever the details shake out, it’s clear that the TikTok saga is a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/tiktok-reaches-deal-oracle-n1238454?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eturning point\u003c/a\u003e in U.S.-China relations. For years, China has demanded steep concessions from American firms to operate in the mainland; now the U.S. is returning the favor with its historic intervention in a major Chinese cultural export. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F09%2F13%2Fchina-reportedly-will-block-tiktok-sale\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; It doesn't make chips, but instead works behind-the-scenes creating the blueprints for them. Arm's designs are found in nearly all smartphones.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat this deal means: \u003c/strong\u003ea shakeup in the chip industry as Nvidia adds a powerful new dimension to its product lineup. width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzkyL2dhbWVfb2Zfcmlza19wbGF5ZWRfaW5fb2lsX2JhcnJlbHMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSixty years ago today, Saudi Arabia, Iran, Iraq, Kuwait, and Venezuela \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-oil-opec-insight/once-an-american-foe-now-a-friend-opec-turns-60-idUSKBN26406P?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efounded\u003c/a\u003e the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) to coordinate oil policies and counter the influence of British and American producers. But unlike a\u003cspan\u003e cast iron skillet, this cartel hasn’t gotten better with age.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on: \u003c/strong\u003eInternal disagreements, the U.S.’ rise as a leading exporter, and a renewables boom have weakened OPEC’s sway. Its market share has fallen from 50% in 1973 to 30%, while the U.S.’ has doubled in a decade. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\"A functional cartel needs to set tough limits to production and stick to them. OPEC sets easy targets and still often fails to meet them,\" Brown Prof. Jeff Colgan \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.dw.com/en/opec-saudi-arabia-russia-united-states-peak-oil-covid-19/a-54875289?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold DW News\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2016, Russia and nine other producers joined the OPEC+ alliance to increase leverage against the U.S. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut American influence remains strong. \u003c/strong\u003eU.S. sanctions have sidelined Iran and Venezuela, and OPEC’s de facto leader Saudi Arabia has increasingly appeased the Trump administration's demands, including this summer’s historic supply cuts to offset the nosedive in prices from the Astra, which also shrugged off the launch as \"valuable experience,\" wants to eventually provide cheap, frequent trips for satellites. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\"We have a good chance that we will know if the product works by the end of October\"\u003c/strong\u003e—Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/healthcare/516194-pfizer-ceo-preparing-for-likelihood-of-vaccine-approval-before-end-of-year?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ediscussing\u003c/a\u003e his company's potential coronavirus vaccine. Bourla thinks regulators could approve the drug before 2021. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\"The quarantine gave me a chance to think a lot about things, what I want to accomplish, what I want people to remember me by\"\u003c/strong\u003e—Tennis star Naomi Osaka after winning the U.S. Open. Osaka, the world's highest-paid female athlete, used her platform during the tournament to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-meaningful-summer-of-naomi-osaka-11600002023?mod=hp_featst_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edraw attention\u003c/a\u003e to the Black Lives Matter movement. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\"75 per cent are willing to pay for flights to nowhere\"\u003c/strong\u003e—The Straits Times \u003ca href=\"https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/transport/sia-eyeing-flights-to-nowhere-to-give-a-lift-to-ailing-business?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edescribing\u003c/a\u003e Singapore Airlines's plan to launch \"no-destination flights\" to boost business.
